title: Data Governance Analyst II
job_description: OverviewWe're seeking a Governance Analyst II to join our team! This role is responsible for UnityPoint Health’s data governance and integrity processes, drives data management objectives to ensure consistency, uniformity, and accuracy of master and reference data used for reporting and analytics across UnityPoint Health. In addition, the Goverance Analyst II supports the data management needs of UnityPoint Health across all aspects for the supply chain and other support services areas with a primary focus on the management of master data within the Supply Chain Information System.Location: Training will be onsite in Des Moines, Iowa and then will have the ability to work from home.Why UnityPoint Health?Commitment to our Team – We’ve been named a Top 150 Place to Work in Healthcare 2022 by Becker’s Healthcare for our commitment to our team members. Culture – At UnityPoint Health, you matter. Come for a fulfilling career and experience a culture guided by uncompromising values and unwavering belief in doing what's right for the people we serve. Benefits – Our competitive Total Rewards program offers benefits options that align with your needs and priorities, no matter what life stage you’re in. Diversity, Equity and Inclusion Commitment – We’re committed to ensuring you have a voice that is heard regardless of role, race, gender, religion, or sexual orientation. Development – We believe equipping you with support and development opportunities is an essential part of delivering a remarkable employment experience. Community Involvement – Be an essential part of our core purpose—to improve the health of the people and communities we serve. Visit us at UnityPoint.org/careers to hear more from our team members about why UnityPoint Health is a great place to work. https://dayinthelife.unitypoint.org/What are team member vaccine requirements?As part of keeping our communities safe and healthy, all team members must be vaccinated for influenza and Tdap, provide proof of immunity to MMR and varicella, and be tested for tuberculosis. New hires must submit proof of vaccination or an approved exemption to begin work. If you have questions, please contact a recruiter or ask at any time during the interview process. UPH strongly recommends that all team members receive the updated 2023-2024 COVID-19 vaccine, and at this time, UnityPoint Health – Meriter requires Covid-19 vaccination or an approved exemption.ResponsibilitiesMaster DataReceives, researches, validates, normalizes, uploads, inputs and edits requests for additions, changes and inactivation’s to key master data files following guidelines for standardization and normalization. Includes, suppliers and contract master data. Researches, analyzes, designs, and maintains Supply Chain master data within the ERP System. Audits Master Data for cleansing and training assistance needed to keep master data clean. Functions as UnityPoint Health’s subject matter expert (SME) and super user for Supply Chain contract master data. Responsible for management of master data templates and updates in Lawson utilizing research on GHX, GPO and vendor websites. Develops partnerships with distribution team members to ensure accurate pricing information is contained in the ERP system and the distributor’s system by running reports and synchronizing data sets. Collaborate across departments to understand master data needs of the organization in relation to Supply Chain Contract Master Data. Performs data analysis; reviewing and analyzing data to ensure data integrity, standardization, normalization, and conformity of the single source of truth. Facilitates the creation and uploads of data for contracts and service agreements in the ERP system. Works closely with Data Analytics to manage rebate information and general reporting. Manages expiring data to prevent order errors, price discrepancies, and any other barriers to order processing. Facilitates the upload of price changes, contract amendments and addendums, and other data additions, modifications, or deletions using electronic and manual data manipulation processes.Process Improvement/System UpgradesIdentifies areas of continued process improvement for Master data, supply chain and other service solutions. Plays integral role in testing, implementing, and reviewing system upgrades or patches; collaborates with functional and technical staff to coordinate application of upgrade or fix; maintains system tables, documents processes and results. Provides input on the departmental plans, goals, standards, procedures, and instructions, which contribute to the effectiveness of the department in accordance with organizational goals. Participates in the planning and monitoring of quality improvement activities within the department. Researches master data to identify areas impacted and make recommendations to the management and supply chain team for innovative solutions or necessary variations from established process and/or policy. Translate current business challenges into analytical terms and use appropriate techniques to solve problems in the areas of customer fulfillment, procurement, and quality using ERP data. Cross-collaborate globally with area subject matter experts to improve business processes.OperationsManages cost messages and updates PO’s on GHX exceptions. Collaborates with contract managers and vendors to identify and resolve pricing discrepancies to ensure vendors honor contract pricing and coordinate vendor credits where appropriate. Participates in Expiring Contract Meetings to work through all contract extensions, closings, and uploads. Manages contract lines for all of UnityPoint Health including additions, changes, and deletions of items in collaboration with contract management team, and vendors on each expiration or renegotiation. Write, maintain, and support a variety of queries utilizing appropriate tools, assist in development of standard queries for ongoing customer needs; help maintain data integrity in systems by running queries and analyzing data. Act in a leadership role in ERP system related implementations, which may include researching options, developing the business case, status reporting to stakeholders, conducting training to impacted users or coordinating deployment strategy and reporting on project metrics. Research, assess and provide consultation for new solutions, improvements, and/ or enhancements to existing Supply Chain processes or procedures via the use of technology. Monitor and review system upgrades and releases to determine overall impact, and provide ERP enhancement requests to ERP provider. Generate and analyze reports for special projects and monthly contract expirations for the purpose of assisting management with decision making. Perform ad hoc data analysis to uncover critical information. QualificationsEducation:High School Diploma or GEDAssociates Degree preferredExperience:Experience in excess of four (4) years may be substituted for education.Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:Writes, reads, comprehends and speaks fluent English.Microsoft Office – Excel, Word, PowerPoint.Area of Interest: Support Services;FTE/Hours per pay period: 1.0;Department: Supply Chain Informatics;Shift: Monday-Friday, Days;Job ID: 144631;

title: HR Data Analyst I
job_description: What You'll DoWe’re looking for a HR Data Analyst I to join our Human Resources Business Partner team. In this role, you’ll play a vital role in optimizing our HR processes and initiatives through data analysis and insights generation! You'll work closely with our HR team, applying analytical skills and expertise to interpret HR data, identify trends, and provide actionable recommendations to enhance our workforce strategies.Collect, compile, and analyze HR data from various sources, including employee records, performance evaluations, surveys, and HRIS systems. Conduct thorough data analysis to identify patterns, trends, and correlations related to employee demographics, performance, retention, and other key HR metrics.Prepare comprehensive reports and dashboards to visualize HR metrics and trends for internal partners, including HR leaders, department heads, and senior management. Develop standardized and ad-hoc reports to support HR decision-making processes. Present findings and recommendations in a clear and concise manner, using data visualization techniques to communicate complex information effectively.Collaborate with HR business partners and functional teams to understand organizational goals and objectives. Provide analytical support to inform HR strategy development, workforce planning, and talent management initiatives. Find opportunities for process improvement and efficiency gains within HR operations, using data-driven insights to drive continuous improvement.Monitor HR data integrity and ensure compliance with data governance standards.Operating at the intersection of financial services and technology, Principal builds financial tools that help our customers live better lives. We take pride in being a purpose-led firm, motivated by our mission to make financial security accessible to all. Our mission, integrity, and customer focus have made us a trusted leader for more than 140 years!Who You AreBachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field.Proven experience in HR or HR analytics, with a strong understanding of HR processes and metrics.Proficiency in excel tools and data visualization software (e.g., Power BI).Excellent analytical skills, with the ability to interpret complex data sets and generate actionable insights.Strong communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey technical information to non-technical partners.Detail-oriented with a commitment to accuracy and data integrity.Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.Salary Range InformationSalary ranges below reflect targeted base salaries. Non-sales positions have the opportunity to participate in a bonus program. Sales positions are eligible for sales incentives, and in some instances a bonus plan, whereby total compensation may far exceed base salary depending on individual performance. Actual compensation for all roles will be based upon geographic location, work experience, education, licensure requirements and/or skill level and will be finalized at the time of offer.Salary Range (Non-Exempt expressed as hourly; Exempt expressed as yearly)$57000 - $95950 / yearTime Off ProgramFlexible Time Off (FTO) is provided to salaried (exempt) employees and provides the opportunity to take time away from the office with pay for vacation, personal or short-term illness. Employees don’t accrue a bank of time off under FTO and there is no set number of days provided.Pension EligibleYesAdditional InformationWork EnvironmentsThis role offers in-office, and hybrid (blending at least three office days in a typical workweek) work arrangements in Des Moines, IA. You’ll work with your leader to figure out which option may align best based on several factors.Job LevelWe’ll consider talent at the next level with the right experiences and skills.Work Authorization/Sponsorship At this time, we're not considering applicants that need any type of immigration sponsorship (additional work authorization or permanent work authorization) now or in the future to work in the United States. This includes, but IS NOT LIMITED TO: F1-OPT, F1-CPT, H-1B, TN, L-1, J-1, etc. For additional information around work authorization needs please use the following links.Nonimmigrant Workers and Green Card for Employment-Based ImmigrantsInvestment Code of Ethics For Principal Asset Management positions, you’ll need to follow an Investment Code of Ethics related to personal and business conduct as well as personal trading activities for you and members of your household. These same requirements may also apply to other positions across the organization.Experience PrincipalAt Principal, we value connecting on both a personal and professional level. Together, we’re imagining a more purpose-led future for financial services – and that starts with you. Our success depends on the unique experiences, backgrounds, and talents of our employees. And we support our employees the same way we support our customers: with comprehensive, competitive benefit offerings crafted to protect their physical, financial, and social well-being. Check out our careers site to learn more about our purpose, values and benefits.Principal is an Equal Opportunity Employer All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.Posting WindowWe will accept applications for 3 full days following the Original Posting Date, after which the posting may remain open or be removed based upon applications received. If we choose to post the job again, we will accept additional applications for at least 1 full day following the Most Recently Posted Date. Please submit applications in a timely manner as there is no guarantee the posting will be available beyond the applicable deadline.Original Posting Date4/17/2024Most Recently Posted Date4/17/2024

title: Health care Data Analytics and Visualization Senior consultant
job_description: Healthcare Data Analytics and Visualization Senior ConsultantAre you a Federal Data Analytics/ Informatics subject matter expert with technical/functional Medicare Data Analytics experience? Do you want to help us transform the Medicare market as it embraces modularization, and we help our clients create a new future for Medicaid technology?Work you'll doProvide expertise on Medicare (preferably Claims) Healthcare AnalyticsDevelop healthcare data analysis visualizations and support data linkages to those visualizationsPerform data modeling, database development and managementDevelop user stories and mockups for data visualizationPerform coding and testing of data visualizations using open source or visualization packages such as Tableau.Drive client conversations around data design and analytics.Implement technology-enabled business solutions for clients as part of a high-talent team.The teamOur Health Technology team implements repeatable solutions to solve our government clients' most critical health technology related issues. We advise on, design, implement and deploy solutions focused on government health agencies "heart of the business" issues including claims management, electronic health records, health information exchanges, health analytics and health case management.Our clients seek a fresh perspective on how to leverage reusable, interoperable and flexible solutions that will enable them to reduce costs, improve health outcomes and respond to public health crises. Professionals will use their deep health, government and technology consulting experience to strategically help solve our client's technology challenges.Qualifications4+ years of experience working within a Health Tech environmentBachelor's degree from accredited college or universityHealthcare Data Informatics/ Analytics experienceMust be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the futureDesired:Working knowledge of healthcare claims data, preferably Medicare data.Technical data analysis skills, working with measures, statistical packages, and/or coding languages.Experience developing healthcare data analysis visualizations and supporting data linkages to those visualizations.Experience with data modeling and database development and management.Experience coding and testing data visualizations using open source or visualization packages such as Tableau or SAS.Strong communication and management skills.Preferred Bachelor's Degree in healthcare and/or computer science or experience equivalent.Ability to travel up to 50%The wage range for this role takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and other business and organizational needs. The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled. At Deloitte, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range is $97,875 to $163,125.You may also be eligible to participate in a discretionary annual incentive program, subject to the rules governing the program, whereby an award, if any, depends on various factors, including, without limitation, individual and organizational performance.Information for applicants with a need for accommodation:https://www2.deloitte.com/us/en/pages/careers/articles/join-deloitte-assistance-for-disabled-applicants.html

title: App Innovation Senior Technology Specialist - Digital Natives
job_description: We are seeking a skilled App Innovation Technical Specialist to join our vibrant Digital Natives Tech Unit within the EMEA region. In this dynamic role, you will act as a catalyst, empowering cutting-edge startups and Digital Natives to exploit the full capabilities of Azure, focusing on app development, PaaS, and DevOps. Your technical guidance will be key in steering the most disruptive start-ups and unicorns in building the next generation SaaS solutions through the power of Azure’s PaaS solutions and services.As our technical authority on application innovation and development, your responsibilities include delivering compelling presentations, engineering impactful demonstrations, and steering proofs of concept that encourage the adoption of our solutions. Your role is instrumental in fostering customer relationships, influencing pivotal decision-makers, and hastening app innovation by illustrating how our technology can address tangible business problems.With a profound understanding of the Azure platform and app development landscape, you will articulate complex ideas to a varied audience, including technical peers and senior executives, ensuring they recognize the strategic value of Azure PaaS in fostering both business and technological growth. Collaborating closely with our sales and partner ecosystems, you will devise and implement strategies to identify fresh opportunities, driving incremental sales and enhancing customer engagement.ResponsibilitiesKey responsibilities include:Providing expert technical guidance on Azure application innovation, including PaaS, DevOps, and advanced app coding techniques.Assisting customers with app modernization strategies and the technical architecture required to implement comprehensive solutions on Azure, leveraging best practices.Demonstrate in-depth knowledge of orchestration tools like Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS), helping customers to manage, scale, and deploy containerized applications seamlessly.Architect solutions that efficiently support multitenancy, enabling optimized resource utilization and cost-effectiveness without compromising on isolation and security between tenants.Acting as a trusted advisor to our top clients, helping them incorporate Azure app development services into their overarching cloud strategy, and recommending migration paths and architectures that include Azure PaaS services.Conducting architectural design sessions to establish implementation plans aligned with customer business objectives and their technical infrastructure.Guide customers through complex scenarios involving hybrid and multi-cloud container deployments, ensuring seamless integration and management across various platforms.Addressing a range of customer readiness challenges including security, performance, scalability, and intellectual property considerations.Engaging with customers and collaborating with account and partner teams to drive new opportunities, resolve technical obstacles, and contribute strategies to expedite deal closure.Remaining continually abreast of advancements and trends in cloud app development to ensure our team and our solutions stay at the industry's forefront.Influencing Azure app innovation strategy by advocating for customer needs and requirements.Being an Azure Platform evangelist, inspiring customers, partners, and the external community, fostering developer communities through various outreach activities.QualificationsMicrosoft is an equal opportunity employer. title: People Analytics Visier Senior Consultant
job_description: The Human Capital Offering Portfolio focuses on helping organizations manage and sustain their performance through their most important asset: their people. Centered on five core issues, this Portfolio signifies to the market that we see Human Capital as a topic critical to the C-Suite. As we go-to-market we will show our clients that we serve more than HR organizations - from the CEO to CFO, Risk Manager to Business Unit leader-and that we deliver on our issues and help create value for our clients.Human Capital As-A-ServiceToday's disruptive environment calls for a different mindset and a new approach to drive organizational performance and enhance human capital development now and in the future. Deloitte Human Capital as a Service brings that insight, through broad and deep capabilities to help our clients optimize people, process, and technology to thrive in an unpredictable worldWork you'll doAs aPeople Analytics Senior Consultant,you willengage with clients to advance their people analytics capabilities across strategy, people, process, data and technology and to help them to deliver business-driven, actionable people insights across work, workforce and workplace topics (e.g., DEI, attrition, mobility, future of work, talent acquisition, compensation, performance management, etc).You'll work with an experienced team to help organizations navigate the future with confidence, embracing decision-making with clear, data-driven insights. Depending on your passion, capability, and experience your project work could include the following:Conduct current state assessments or discoveries to understand client people analytics maturity, synthesize findings, and communicate key themesLead and support the development of a client's people analytics vision, strategy, operating model and roadmap for scaling people analyticsUtilize Human Capital Management (HCM), people analytics, or enterprise and BI platforms to design, build, test and deploy reports, dashboards, data visualizations, and predictive models based on project requirementsAssist with end-to-end analytics process, including cleansing and wrangling structured and unstructured data, designing and building analytics and models, extracting insights and findings, visualizing outputs, and communicating outcomes to the client and other stakeholdersLeverage quantitative and qualitative data and analytics methods to analyze client data across HR and people analytics focus areasDefine top client business questions and challenges by conducting client interviews, synthesizing findings, and identifying key themes coming out of discovery work and client communicationsDevelop data visualizations that highlight key insights to help clients make informed business decisions related to human capital issues and communicate these insights to relevant stakeholdersEngage, communicate, and build relationships with internal and external stakeholders across geographies-both national and international-on both technical and non-technical people analytics topicsRequired QualificationsBachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Analytics, IT or relevant field4+ years ofhands-on experience in Human Capital Consulting or closely related experience in a as the people analytics platform for an organization or implementing a new data subject to expand Visier capability.4+ years serving the HR Domain in areas such as recruiting, attrition, DE&I, title: Software Test Engineer | 38676
job_description: Join Cerebral Staffing, LLC on site at our client John Deere in Waterloo, IA as a Software Test Engineer!Location: Waterloo, IADuration of Role: 3+ yearsPay: $45.50 - $48.75 / hourlyHours: 1st shift – 7:00 am - 3:30 pmVisa sponsorship is not available, now or in the near future, for this position.DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:As a Tractor Software Subsystem Test Engineer, you will be accountable for software verification, test planning, and test execution for embedded software on tractors. The focus for the subsystem testing is on a tractor subsystem with an emphasis on drivetrain control subsystem. You will be integrated with and located in the Waterloo software delivery team which develops the tractor sub-system control software. In addition, you will: Create the tractor sub-system software verification test plan for the features being delivered and defects being fixed once per software planning session (that is, once every two-month period) Define the appropriate level of regression testing required in each round of testing Increase test case automation for the control subsystem Be accountable for software verification and test execution Be responsible for tracking metrics as defined by the Software Test Supervisor (requirements to test case coverage, test case data, test results, defects found, defects escaped) Assure the availability of test environments (Model in the Loop (MiL), Software in the Loop (SiL), Hardware in the Loop (HiL), Vehicle in the Loop (ViL).) and define which test environments to use based on the test strategy Bachelors of Science in Electronics/Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Technology, or other relevant disciplineREQUIRED: One or more years of experience working in mechatronics; including a solid understanding of electrical and electronics, hydraulics, and mechanical systems One or more years of control system experience preferably related to propulsion systems and/or agriculture equipment One or more years of experience with embedded control systems in either product development or product test One or more years of experience with electronic test tools and simulation tools to assist in analysis and verificationDESIRED: Experience working with Model Based Software Design (MBSD) and/or system simulation (For example, experience using Matlab or Simulink) Experience working with test case automation tools (For example, experience using ECU-Test) Experience working in an Agile/Scrum software development environment One or more years of experience with CAN bus and tools used for testing and analysis Experience operating Agricultural / off-road equipment ISTQB (International Software Testing Qualifications Board) Certification or equivalentAdditional notes:This position will work onsite immediately. Interviews will be conducted via MS Teams. Business casual dress code. Metatarsal shoes will be required for the first day. No driving required.Powered by JazzHRPWanfgruHy

title: Research Scientist
job_description: Title: Research Scientist Location: Ames, IA Duration: 18+ Months Shift: Monday to Friday 08:00 am to 05:00 pm  Duties Experience in performing bio-analytical methods (immunological, microbiological, molecular biological, or virological) following defined processes. Experience with mammalian cell culture, and in standard molecular biology techniques such as cloning, DNA purification, and protein expression is preferred. Initiates, executes, completes, and communicates results and related issues with supervision. Provide quality support of Expression Platforms team members through data acquisition, reporting, and communication. Execute in vitro analytical assays to evaluate samples with minimal supervision. Accountable for performing all techniques and assays so test sessions yield valid results and repeated work is minimized. Accurately record all data from research techniques and tests on data capture forms, research notebooks, and raw data notebooks as appropriate. Perform initial data analysis so that accurate and precise results are obtained and reported. Generate documentation (ex. method protocols, reports) in support of techniques or modification of techniques. Ability to learn new types of assays and technology easily. Be able to perform, analyze and interpret results. Maintains a constructive and positive attitude for working on projects in the Expression Platforms Team, and for working at Client. Follow Research & Development policies and procedures to maintain high quality standards and follow best practices.  Skills: Able to competently perform multiple types of assays (biochemical, molecular and immunological in nature). Experience in assay development, mammalian cell culture, ELISA, Western blotting, qPCR, and experience in standard molecular biology techniques such as cloning, protein expression and purification is preferred. Strict adherence to defined assay method protocols. Extremely organized with attention to detail. Can learn new types of assays and technology easily. Exceptional written and verbal communications skills. Proactive and resourceful. Proficient in Microsoft Office. Exceptional interpersonal skills; High level of comfort/ease interacting with all levels of the organization.  Education  : BS degree from an accredited institution in a relevant scientific discipline; or Biotechnology Laboratory Methods certification in combination with AS degree and relevant job experience.

title: Aerospace Software Engineer
job_description: What We are looking for;Title: Software Engineer - Data Link Products Location: Cedar Rapid, IA Onsite from Day 1 Monday to Friday. Key Words; C++, DO178C Development Must to Have.In this role person candidate should need to work as an individual has a strong background in independent aerospace development, with a deep understanding of the DO178 B/C guidance processes, which are crucial for ensuring the safety and reliability of software in airborne systems. Their expertise lies in the redesign and development of systems using C++ programming language, specifically tailored for aerospace applications. They have significant experience in embedded development, which involves designing and implementing software that runs on embedded systems with limited resources. Furthermore, they are well-versed in 429 ARINC communication protocols, which are widely used in avionics systems for data communication between different onboard systems. This expertise is essential for ensuring interoperability and compatibility within complex aerospace systems. In terms of preferred companies, they are interested in opportunities with reputable organizations such as L&T, Cyient, Quest Global, Thales, Boeing, and Safran. These companies are known for their contributions to the aerospace industry and offer exciting prospects for individuals with the skills and experience this individual possesses.

title: QA Engineer
job_description: Lee Enterprises is looking for a full-stack QA engineer with a deep understanding of manual, API, and automated agile testing in the SDLC. This position involves working with a group of talented engineers to build front-end applications utilizing cloud back-end services and other modern technologies. You will create, execute, and maintain manual, mobile and web automated tests in an agile environment. Skills Needed/ Basic Qualifications:  2 + years of automating native mobile applications and mobile browser applications (JavaScript preferred). This is a must-have experience.  2 + years of working knowledge with Appium.  5 + years of Selenium or Cypress or WebDriver IO experience with web automation.  5 + years of scripting experience with JavaScript or Python or another object-oriented program.  5 + years of working knowledge of UI Automation testing and API testing.  Hands-on experience building automation frameworks from scratch.  Experience building automation deployment pipelines in AWS or Azure Devops (nice to have)  Job responsibilities: You will, be required to test stories/bugs and then incrementally build automated functional/regression tests.  be responsible for developing and executing test plans and supporting production releases.  build mobile automated tests from scratch using JavaScript/Appium  build UI automation tests from scratch (selenium or similar)  be able to test API manually or with automated calls.  collaborate with Developers, product owners, and other SDETs to strategize and execute test plans.  be an advocate for software quality throughout all phases of development.  effectively communicate test status and progress to all stakeholders. You will find, document, and track bugs on a need basis.  be responsible for all types of software testing in a scrum team.  Here’s what we offer:  Fully remote position  Flexible time off policy  Very competitive salary  A great team to work with  Health, vision and dental insurances  401k match  Pay  : $115,000- $125,000 Why Join Us? Lee Enterprises offers competitive wages in a dynamic, interesting work environment with career growth opportunities. We offer an extensive benefit program that can be personalized to your needs. Our benefit program includes medical, dental, vision, short and long-term disability, company provided life insurance and supplemental life insurance. In addition, we offer a 401K retirement plan with company match. We also offer generous paid time off to allow the flexibility to balance personal life and work. This includes paid parental leave for new parents.Lee Enterprises is a major subscription and advertising platform and a leading provider of local news and information, with daily newspapers, rapidly growing digital products and nearly 350 weekly and specialty publications serving 74 markets in 26 states. Lee websites reach more than 34 million digital unique visitors.Lee Enterprises is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to attracting and retaining a workforce whose diversity reflects the communities we serve. Lee embraces change, and we recognize that we must create and maintain a culture of fervent inclusion. For more information about Lee, check us out at www.lee.net .We are focused on building a diverse and inclusive workforce. If you are excited about this role but do not meet 100% of the qualifications above, we encourage you to apply.Apply Now
Industries: Advertising Services, Newspaper Publishing, and Online Audio and Video Media

title: Fanuc Robot Automation Engineering Programmer - Pay is $25 to $35 + OT
job_description: Job DescriptionFanuc Robot Automation Design Engineering ProgrammerThree plus years of experience programming Fanuc robots from scratch is required to be consideredTravel up to 30% is required for this positionPay is $25 to $35 per hour plus overtimeMust be a United States or Green Card holderNo remoteFull-timePermanent W-2 employeeFull benefitsNo relocationCouncil Bluffs, Iowa areaThis full time, permanent Fanuc Robotic Automation Engineering Programmer career opportunity is at a well-respected robotic and automation company. The culture of this Fanuc integrator is friendly and team-oriented. Work hours can be flexible. Employees enjoy utilizing a very wide variety of technologies. They promote from within on up to management. Employees are trained and certified much more than at other employers. Work is challenging and rewarding as the company takes on the more difficult, riskier projects that really grow an employee's skills. Employees are never bored as projects are exciting systems and have an extreme variety.ResponsibilitiesThe career path for this position could lead to more of an engineering role or service role, if those are of interest. The successful candidate should be responsible for the following:Creating Fanuc robot programs from scratchComing up from scratch with what the robot needs to do (a lot of machine tool load and unload) Solving the issues and providing the entire solutionActing as a technical expertInvestigating and resolving HMI and PLC issues as neededTraveling to Wisconsin-based companies (rarely gets up to 30%)The background of the successful candidate must include the following:Three plus years of Fanuc robot programming from scratch experiencePossess ability to investigate and resolve HMI and PLC issues as neededAbility to work well independently on smaller projectsAbility to work well as part of a team on larger projectsAbility to travel up to 30% (travel that high is rare) to Wisconsin-based companiesPossess a valid driver's licenseA solid work historyA US or possess a green cardA residence within 45 minutes

title: Power Platform Developer
job_description: Title  Power Platform Developer   Location  Des Moines IA (Remote)    Rate  DOE /If your experience and skills match call us immediately for submission   Duration  12 Months   Interview Type  Either Webcam Interview or In Person   Job Type  C2C,W2   Experience  3 Years         Job Description   The DOM Division of Information Technology (DoIT) digital service team is looking for a Microsoft Power Platform developer to assist with a Drupal form redevelopment project.  The DOM Division of Information Technology (DoIT) digital service team is looking for a Microsoft Power Platform developer to assist with a Drupal form redevelopment project. The DOM DoIT Power Platform developer is responsible for creating and publishing Microsoft Power Platform content on a variety of state agency websites in support of the enterprise initiative to implement a consistent brand and improve the constituent experience.  Microsoft Power Platform developer to rebuild existing Drupal forms in Microsoft Power Pages along with associated Power Automate workflows.  The Power Platform Developer will be expected to work with agency content managers to confirm whether content is external or internal facing, what workflows need to be associated with the content, and where the resulting data will be stored and accessed by State staff.  The Power Platform Developer will then handle additional requests from across the enterprise to publish new and updated Power Pages, Power Apps, and Power Automate flows and verify, maintain, and update as necessary Power Platform content. The goals for the Microsoft Power Platform Developer are to design and develop primarily public facing Power Pages along with associated Power Automate workflows. The Microsoft Power Platform Developer will also be involved in training agency staff and managers on the use of the developed Power Platform content and handling the resulting backend data.  Skills used in this position:  Digital Experience Web Form Creation in Microsoft Power Platform Create custom forms, templates and workflows using PowerApps. Responsible for creating accessible WCAG 2.1 AA compliant forms. Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into technical solutions using Power Forms. Create Power Automate flows to automate business processes. Provide operational support for Power Apps, and Power Automate services. Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to Power Forms functionality and integration. Conduct user training and provide ongoing support for Power Forms solutions. Create system and end user documentation.  Requirements:  Experience with Power Automate - Required – 3Years Experience with Dataverse - Required – 3 Years Experience with Power Pages - Required – 3 Years Experience with Power Apps - Required – 3 Years Experience with SharePoint - Required – 3 Years Familiarity with DevOps practices and tools, such as Azure DevOps - Required – 3 Years Experience with MS Sql Server , C# .Net - Required– 3 Years Experience with Office 365 - Required – 3 Years                          Skill              Required / Desired   Amount   of Experience       Experience with Power Automate    Required 3 Years    Experience with Dataverse  Required 3 Years    Experience with Power Pages  Required 3 Years    Experience with Power Apps  Required 3 Years    Experience with SharePoint  Required 3 Years    Familiarity with DevOps practices and tools, such as Azure DevOps  Required 3 Years    Experience with MS Sql Server , C# .Net  Required 3 Years    Experience with Office 365  Required 3 Years

title: Software Engineer
job_description: Please note that this position is based on our campus in Madison, WI, and requires relocation to the area. We recruit nationally and provide financial relocation assistance.Code that saves lives. As a software developer at Epic, you’ll write software that impacts the lives of 75% of Americans and 300 million patients around the world. Working in your own office, surrounded by thousands of high-caliber developers, you’ll use modern development methodologies and employ user-centered design, analytics, and machine learning tools to drive innovation in healthcare. Using leading-edge technologies and languages like JS, TS, and C#, you’ll invent better ways to reduce medical errors, streamline record sharing between hospitals, and provide the quality of care a patient deserves.Write software for the most innovative health systems on the planet.The top-ranked health systems in U.S. News and World Report are Epic customers. Our community includes major systems like the Mayo Clinic, Johns Hopkins, Cleveland Clinic, and Kaiser Permanente, as well as leading academic medical centers at the University of Wisconsin, University of Michigan, University of California, University of Texas, The Ohio State University, and many more.Experience our state-of-the-art campus, eat delicious food, and travel the world.We don’t believe in cubicles. (Well, we believe they exist, but…) Our uniquely themed campus was designed to heighten your ability to get stuff done in your office, a conference room, or by the fireplace in a comfy chair. For lunch, visit King’s Cross or Cassiopeia for a wide array of meal options, or go to one of our smaller, themed bistros, featuring wood-rotisserie, pan-Asian, and Latin-inspired cuisine. All meals are restaurant-quality but cost only a few dollars, and they’re prepared by a team comprised of kitchen talent from restaurants around the country. And, after five years here, you’ll earn a four-week sabbatical anywhere in the world. Staff have kayaked in Patagonia, attended a Beyoncé concert in Ireland, built a library in Tanzania, and run a marathon in Antarctica.Live affordably in a city known for its rising tech talent.Epic is located just outside Madison, Wisconsin, which is the second fastest growing market for tech talent in the United States, home to the state capital, and the University of Wisconsin. Madison has received accolades for being the greenest city in America (NerdWallet), the best city for renters (SmartAsset), fittest city in America (Fitbit), and, for the gamers, is one of a handful of US cities to have a Killer Queen arcade game, located at Madison’s first arcade bar.More than just important work.We offer comprehensive benefits to keep you healthy and happy as you grow in your life and career, and your merit-based compensation will reflect the impact your work has on the company and our customers. You'll also be eligible for annual raises and bonuses, as well as stock grants, which give you an even greater stake in the success of Epic and our customers. Epic is an Equal Opportunity employer. We seek diverse perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences in our mission to improve healthcare. Research has shown that job-seekers who are women, LGBTQ+, or members of the global majority are less likely to apply for roles they don't seem completely qualified for, so we encourage all who are interested to apply. title: Entry-Level Mule IPC Engineer
job_description: About the RoleIn today's automotive landscape, vehicles are increasingly interconnected. Interfacing with external systems like the Internet and cameras, allows manufacturers to gather valuable data, develop insights, and update vehicles with critical information. This burgeoning field demands skilled technical professionals who thrive on the cutting edge of automotive technology. We are seeking entry-level Mule IPC Engineers eager to immerse themselves in these latest advancements. Note: due to demand, candidates may specialize in other Automotive Engineering categories.About RevatureRevature is one of the largest and fastest-growing employers of emerging technology talent across the U.S. As a Revature Mule IPC Engineer you will have the opportunity to gain valuable experience and learn tailored skills to become an important, effective engineer for a Fortune 500 company. With no prior experience, you will learn on the job. But this is no boot camp where you pay for training, at Revature we pay you to learn and expertly prepare you for a career in Mule IPC Engineering.What We're Looking For:· 4-year degree, Computer Science or in Electrical, Automotive, or Computer Engineering· Proven problem solving and troubleshooting skills· Proven team player with strong collaboration skills· Impressive communication skills· A self-starter who is eager to embrace new responsibilities· Knowledge of CAN-based communication and tools· Experience with multimeters and oscilloscopes· Automotive knowledge is a plus· Knowledge of CAN-FD is a plus· Knowledge of Ethernet protocol is a plus· Experience with CAN Vector tools (Canoe, CANalyzer, CANAPE, NeoVI) is a plus· Experience with architecture/system integration is a plus· Open to nationwide relocation – please ask about Revature’s relocation assistance programsEqual Opportunity EmployerRevature (“Company”) is an equal opportunity employer. We will extend equal opportunity to all individuals without regard to race, religion, color, sex, pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, genetic information, marital status, veteran status, or any other status protected under applicable federal, state, or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including but not limited to, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, benefits, compensation, and training. If you require accommodation to work based on any of these protected factors, please notify the Human Resources Department, and the Company will evaluate the request and provide accommodation in accordance with applicable law.We seek to comply with all applicable federal, state, and local laws related to discrimination and will not tolerate interference with the ability of any of the Company's employees to perform their job duties. title: Salesforce Developer
job_description: Are you an experienced Salesforce developer who is always looking for new ways to solve problems, meet challenges, and improve software capability and functionality? If so, we want you to join our team and contribute your expertise to design and build world-class applications to meet evolving requirements and improve our internal and client-facing Salesforce environment. Our Technology team is expanding & we are seeking a growth-minded individual to join as a Salesforce Developer .We will consider candidates within certain states in the United States.The Salesforce Developer’ s role is to automate business processes to improve efficiencies, improve client experience, and fuel revenue growth through the use of technology. The Salesforce Developer will be responsible for the design, development, implementation, and maintenance of Salesforce applications. The ideal candidate will have a solid background in Salesforce development and will be comfortable working independently and as part of a team.Essential Job Functions & ResponsibilitiesWork with business users and analysts to understand business requirements related to software, integrations, and data analytic needs.Provide support for system changes and enhancements to sales management systems including Salesforce and other enterprise technologies. Assist with the preparation and installation of solutions by analyzing business needs, determining and designing system specifications, standards, and programming.Develop and support software solutions to support the business strategy. Perform revision, repair, or expansion of existing solutions to increase operating efficiency or adapt to new requirements. Improve operations by conducting systems analysis, recommending changes, and implementing changes.Work with internal resources and 3rd party vendors in the implementation of software solutions.Prepare workflow charts and diagrams that describe input, output, and logical operation, and convert them into high-quality computer programs. Write, analyze, review, and rewrite programs, using design diagrams, and applying knowledge of computer capabilities, subject matter and symbolic logic.Conduct various testing cycles and trial runs of programs and software applications to be sure they will produce the desired results. Compile and write documentation of program development and subsequent revisions. Write or contribute to instructions or manuals to guide end users.Thrive in a dynamic, high-performance culture with minimal supervision.Increase job knowledge by studying state-of-the-art development tools, programming techniques, and computing equipment, participating in educational opportunities, reading professional publications, maintaining personal networks, and participating in professional organizations.Possess strong commitment to team environment dynamics with the ability to contribute expertise and follow leadership directives at appropriate times.Play a key role as a Salesforce technical expert and administrator.Provide exceptional customer service.Education & ExperienceBachelor’s Degree, preferably in a Computer Science/Information Systems/MIS or related field and/or equivalent work experience is required.1 – 5 years’ development experience desired. Experience with the following technologies: SalesforceSQL – Queries, Stored Procedures, ETL, Reporting and AnalysisExperience on projects doing requirements gathering, and working directly with business users is preferred.Strong IT experience doing high-level designs, following structured and disciplined design methodologies.Those achieving success in this position usually have the following skills: Ability to maintain positive and professional attitude under pressure; ability to communicate well with internal customers; strong organizational skills; flexible, ability to multi-task.Skills & CompetenciesExperience with Salesforce ecosystem, administration, and development.Knowledge of various software languages. Specifically VB, C# and other Microsoft based application languages. Knowledge of Microsoft.Net and SQL Server.Familiarity with: Microsoft - PowerBI Microsoft - Power AutomateMicrosoft - Power AppsMicrosoft – Teams / SharePointMicrosoft - Azure CloudIdentity Management – SAMLAbility to work with end users to translate high-level requirements into a solution approach including both high level and detailed estimates.Ability to quickly understand both business and technical concepts.Self-starter with strong verbal and written communication skills.Business Analysis, Software Design, Software Debugging, Software Documentation, Software Testing, Software Maintenance, Software Performance Tuning, User Interface Design, Web Programming Skills, Understanding of Browser Capabilities..NET, SQL, ASP.NET, C#, JavaScript, IIS, HTML.Performance Monitoring techniques, load testing techniques.Knowledge of insurance industry and Insurance Industry software, Applied Systems, EPIC. #SeniorWhat TrueNorth OffersTrueNorth offers a lineup of excellent benefits to all full-time employees, including: Annual Bonus  Medical, Dental, Vision  401k with company contributions after six (6) months  Responsible Time Off and 11 Paid Holidays  Company-paid Life and Disability coverage  Volunteer Time Off and Donation Match Program  Tuition Reimbursement, Employee Assistance Program (EAP) and a Wellness Program with great incentives.  Hybrid work schedule  Why should you join TrueNorth? We are a company focused on developing our people and growing the business. We offer a competitivebenefit package, wellbeing programs and incentives, and a positive work culture.TrueNorth is honored to be recognized by Inc 5000's as a Fastest Growing Company!Click  here  to view a video about TrueNorth's Core Values & what they mean to us.TrueNorth makes all employment-related decisions on the basis ofqualifications, merit, and business need, and does not discriminate against any applicant on the basis ofrace, color, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, religion, national origin, citizenship status,disability, ancestry, marital status, veteran status, medical condition or any other category protected local, state or federal laws.Join us!

title: Site Reliability Engineer
job_description: GENERAL PURPOSE OF THE JOBSite Reliability Engineers (SREs) are responsible for ensuring the reliability, availability, and performance of AEL’s technology systems. The role combines aspects of software engineering and operations to create scalable and highly reliable application and infrastructure systems. The Site Reliability Engineer partners closely with Marketing, Distribution, Services, Technology, and Operations teams to vision, roadmap, and drive delivery of agreed Service Level Indications (SLIs), Service Level Objectives (SLOs), and Service Level Agreements (SLAs) for American Equity and Eagle Life technology driven systems. The positional utilizes their strong background in site reliability engineering, software & infrastructure engineering, a deep understanding of agile methodologies, and a proven track record of delivering high-quality products and solutions in large-scale, complex environments.ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESSystem Architecture: Collaborates with development teams to design and implement scalable and reliable software systems that have quantifiable SLIs, SLOs, and SLAs.Automation: Collaborates in the development of automation tools and scripts to streamline operations and reduce manual intervention in system maintenance tasks, testing, and release procedures.Monitoring and Incident Response: Implements monitoring solutions to proactively identify and address potential issues. Measures response to incidents to minimize downtime.Capacity Planning: Analyzes system performance and plans for future capacity needs. Ensures that systems can scale to handle growing workloads.Infrastructure as Code (IaC): Implements and maintains infrastructure monitoring using IaC principles. Manage monitoring solution configurations and deployments efficiently.Reliability Engineering: Works towards improving the reliability of systems through proactive measures and continuous improvement processes.Collaboration: Collaborates with cross-functional teams, including developers, operations, and other stakeholders, to ensure a holistic approach to system reliability.Troubleshooting: Diagnoses and resolves complex technical issues affecting system performance and reliability.Documentation: Maintains detailed documentation of monitoring system configurations, processes, and procedures.On-call Support: Participates in an on-call rotation to provide 24/7 support for critical monitoring systems.Performs other related duties as assigned. SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIESNone EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCEBachelor's degree in a related field or equivalent professional experience; Master's degree is a plus.Six (6) years of site reliability engineering, software or infrastructure engineering, or IT Operations leadership role preferred. CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, PROFESSIONAL DESIGNATIONSN/AKNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIESProven ability to drive organization alignment that meets cross functional requirements and is aligned to customer needs.Establishes credibility and trust-based relationships. Able to influence outcomes across the team, business functions, and with key executive leaders while getting buy-in and alignment across all levels of the organization.Observed fluency in infrastructure technologies and demonstrated ability to partner with infrastructure technology, development, and business leaders for solution delivery.Strong understanding of agile principles and practices. Ability to drive priorities according to customer and business value.Excellent communication skills with the ability to engage, influence, and inspire partners and stakeholders to drive alignment and adoption.Demonstrated ability to drive SRE constructs using Datadog is desirable.Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

title: Infrastructure Engineer Jr
job_description: Description Looking for an Infrastructure Engineer-Jr., but this will be more of a customer service position with IT support. -Looking for someone with an understanding of organization, communication, customer service. -This role will maintain high levels of customer service. Interpersonal skills needed, as well as ability to collaborate. -Role will involve taking questions from business partners, viewing client data, helping with IT asset management systems, organizing and reviewing hardware inventories, looking up warranty status on hardware, reviewing requests, submitting security requests for logins to website, working with BUs to assist advisors with questions and needs. All will be internal information. -In house training on Principal systems and business knowledge will be provided. -Training turnaround is 4 months. -Soft skills important here. Call Center or Customer Service experience in their background is a plus. -Need someone with a 4-year degree -Call numbers will depend on the day, could be 15-30-some days will be busier than others. -$63,400 conversion salary if worker is converted to FTE. A panel of leaders for this team include (Steven Ringhofer, Amanda Leopard, Steven Kirkpatrick, Colin Scott and Levi Miller. Levi and 1 of the additional people for the interviews Rd1. Rd2 interviews will include Kate Gassmann and John Peters. They are looking for a candidate to assist with the current hardware refresh project and assisting with phone support. Along with looking for a candidate with a high ceiling. Day to Day: - They could be assisting with the roll out of new equipment (imaging, software installation, handling the migrations) or they could be answering business partner’s technical calls, emails, IM’s, etc. - Technologies or systems that will utilized : Windows Operating System, Microsoft Office, PFG proprietary software, Mobile Devices, Laptop/Desktop/iPad, Citrix Receiver/XenDesktop/XenApp, Cisco networking LAN/WAN/Wireless - Must Haves *Relevant internship or professional experience in an IT customer service, IT support or IT troubleshooting role or related experience - Basic planning/organizational, time management, decision-making, and superb written/verbal communication skills Must be able to maintain accuracy and confidentiality Possess strong problem-solving and big-picture/conceptual skills Must be able to work with people at all levels and demonstrate the ability to understand and embrace change - - Size and culture of the team - - They're a team of about 60 people. Primarily providing hardware/software support through calls, walkup, email and IM. They support roughly 6,000 people throughout the US. They’re a little different than other support teams, as they don’t have a tiered helpdesk and they don’t escalate issues between technicians on the team. Instead they have a strong focus on collaboration within the team. Communication is key as well. Skills PC Technician, hardware support, imaging, customer support Top Skills Details PC Technician,hardware support,imaging,customer support Additional Skills & Qualifications Strong customer service skills. Team player mentality. Patience and problem solving skills. Experience Level Intermediate Level About TEKsystems We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. We are a team of 80,000 strong, working with over 6,000 clients, including 80% of the Fortune 500, across North America, Europe and Asia. As an industry leader in Full-Stack Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership. title: Power Platform Developer
job_description: The DOM DoIT Power Platform developer is responsible for creating and publishing Microsoft Power Platform content on a variety of state agency websites in support of the enterprise initiative to implement a consistent brand and improve the constituent experience. Microsoft Power Platform developer to rebuild existing Drupal forms in Microsoft Power Pages along with associated Power Automate workflows. The Power Platform Developer will be expected to work with agency content managers to confirm whether content is external or internal facing, what workflows need to be associated with the content, and where the resulting data will be stored and accessed by State staff. The Power Platform Developer will then handle additional requests from across the enterprise to publish new and updated Power Pages, Power Apps, and Power Automate flows and verify, maintain, and update as necessary Power Platform content.The goals for the Microsoft Power Platform Developer are to design and develop primarily public facing Power Pages along with associated Power Automate workflows.The Microsoft Power Platform Developer will also be involved in training agency staff and managers on the use of the developed Power Platform content and handling the resulting backend data.Skills used in this position:Digital Experience Web Form Creation in Microsoft Power PlatformCreate custom forms, templates and workflows using PowerAppsResponsible for creating accessible WCAG 2.1 AA compliant formsCollaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into technical solutions using Power FormsCreate Power Automate flows to automate business processesProvide operational support for Power Apps, and Power Automate servicesTroubleshoot and resolve issues related to Power Forms functionality and integrationConduct user training and provide ongoing support for Power Forms solutionsCreate system and end user documentationRequirementsExperience with Power Automate - Required - 3YearsExperience with Dataverse - Required - 3 YearsExperience with Power Pages - Required - 3 YearsExperience with Power Apps - Required - 3 YearsExperience with SharePoint - Required - 3 YearsFamiliarity with DevOps practices and tools, such as Azure DevOps - Required - 3 YearsExperience with MS Sql Server , C# .Net - Required- 3 YearsExperience with Office 365 - Required - 3 Years

Excellent problem-solving skills. Ability to work in a team or individually as and when required. Ability to work on multiple tasks at the same time and complete tasks in a timely manner. Excellent oral and written communication skills. Detail-oriented and excellent concentration ability. An analytical mindset and critical thinking. Demonstrable ability to discover and fix errors in code. Strong problem-solving skills with a creative approach. Ability to stay updated with the latest technological development and trends.Interested in hearing more? title: Software Developer III
job_description: We are Athene. At Athene, we are driven to do more. We are a leading retirement services company that issues, reinsures and acquires retirement savings products designed for the increasing number of individuals and institutions seeking to fund retirement needs. We see every day as a new opportunity to measure ourselves against the best - and then we don't stop until we've set the bar even higher. We're ready to help you achieve more.PurposeAs a Software Developer III at Athene, you will be accountable for participating in design, building, and maintaining software applications to meet the needs of our business. You will be developing in Python, JAVA, using Postgres databases, and running our applications in the AWS Cloud.Be part of our Cloud journey and help migrate and modernize existing workloads from our data center to the AWS Cloud.Successful candidates should have a proven track record of delivering high quality solutions by collaborating with a team of analysts and developers.Builds and maintains effective information software applications that assist Athene in minimizing administrative costs and maximizing information flow.AccountabilitiesDesign, write code, and implement highly performant solutions as part of a team of developers and analysts. Provides code review functions for peers and less experienced developers to ensure code meets design expectations with a focus on high availability, performance, security, scalability, and maintainability. Proactively communicate ideas, solutions, and capabilities over and above the specific task request. Document team processes and flows. Leverage Cloud-native architecture components including Containers, immutable infrastructure, Microservices, etc., to build highly available and fault tolerant applications. CloudFormation, Lambda, Containers, Postgres, and many of the AWS tools in the platform will be available to you to build Athene world class applications Maintain and continually improve our Cloud-based infrastructure. Qualifications And ExperienceBachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Systems Analysis, or equivalent work experience. 4+ years of application development experience using Python and relational databases. Proven knowledge of large-scale internal software applications or related technologies. Experience with Agile Scrum development methodologies. Experience with Enterprise Cloud transformation efforts is a plus. Containers: Docker or other OCI-certified containers Understanding of Cloud Native Architecture AWS skills: EC2, S3, EBS, EFS, Lambda etc. Background in Insurance/Financial Industries is preferred. A strong sense of teamwork and ability to both lead and execute programs. Drive. Discipline. Confidence. Focus. Commitment. Learn more about working at Athene.Athene is a Military Friendly Employer! Learn more about how we support our Veterans.Athene celebrates diversity, is committed to inclusion and is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, veteran status or any other status protected by federal, state or local law.PDN-9b9b18e5-0c63-46b2-bbc1-8016e46be14e

title: Experienced Software Engineer (Hybrid)
job_description: What You'll DoElevate by Principal is a fast-growing startup within Principal that is changing the way business owners solve their most pressing concerns. Our team is comprised of highly motivated individuals who are passionate about innovation and creativity. We are looking for a skilled software engineer to join our team and help us continue to build a revolutionary product.As a Software engineer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing software solutions for our product. You will work closely with our product development team to understand user requirements and translate them into technical specifications. You will also be responsible for ensuring that our software products are scalable, reliable, and efficient. As a member of the team, you will: Design and develop software solutions for our product Collaborate with product development team to understand user requirements Translate user requirements into technical specifications Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code Test and debug software to ensure quality and accuracy Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues Participate in code reviews and contribute to the overall improvement of software development processes Stay up to date with emerging trends and technologies in software development Who You AreWe are looking for someone with:Associate or bachelor's degree (preference in a computer science, technology, engineering or math-related field or equivalent experience) or equivalent experience 3 or more years of professional working experience in software development is required. Strong understanding of software development principles and methodologies. Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Excellent communication and collaboration skills. Comfortable collaborating with other engineers in a group setting.Must have the desire and ability to learn new technology and continuously grow.May be required to provide on-call support. Addition Preferred Experience:Salesforce experience (working experience with Apex/Lighting Web Component Development) AWS Experience (working experience with Lambdas, REST APIs, Typescript/JavaScript experience). Front-end development experience (JavaScript/HTML/CSS) Why join us:Opportunity to work on a groundbreaking product that will be a first to market business owner ecosystem Chance to work with a highly motivated and talented team Competitive salary and benefits package Salary Range InformationSalary ranges below reflect targeted base salaries. Non-sales positions have the opportunity to participate in a bonus program. Sales positions are eligible for sales incentives, and in some instances a bonus plan, whereby total compensation may far exceed base salary depending on individual performance. Actual compensation for all roles will be based upon geographic location, work experience, education, licensure requirements and/or skill level and will be finalized at the time of offer.Salary Range (Non-Exempt expressed as hourly; Exempt expressed as yearly)$91000 - $123000 / yearTime Off ProgramFlexible Time Off (FTO) is provided to salaried (exempt) employees and provides the opportunity to take time away from the office with pay for vacation, personal or short-term illness. Employees don’t accrue a bank of time off under FTO and there is no set number of days provided.Pension EligibleYesAdditional InformationWork EnvironmentsThis role offers in-office, hybrid (blending at least three office days in a typical workweek). You’ll work with your leader to figure out which option may align best based on several factors.Work Authorization/Sponsorship At this time, we're not considering candidates that need any type of immigration sponsorship (additional work authorization or permanent work authorization) now or in the future to work in the United States. This includes, but IS NOT LIMITED TO: F1-OPT, F1-CPT, H-1B, TN, L-1, J-1, etc. For additional information around work authorization needs please use the following links.Nonimmigrant Workers and Green Card for Employment-Based ImmigrantsInvestment Code of Ethics For Principal Global Investors positions, you’ll need to follow an Investment Code of Ethics related to personal and business conduct as well as personal trading activities for you and members of your household. These same requirements may also apply to other positions across the organization.Experience PrincipalWhile our expertise spans the globe, we're bound by one common purpose: to foster a world where financial security is accessible to all. And our success depends on the unique experiences, backgrounds, and talents of our employees – individually and all of us together. Explore our core values, benefits and why we’re an exceptional place to grow your career.Principal is an Equal Opportunity Employer All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.Posting WindowWe will accept applications for 3 full days following the Original Posting Date, after which the posting may remain open or be removed based upon applications received. If we choose to post the job again, we will accept additional applications for at least 1 full day following the Most Recently Posted Date. title: data analyst
job_description: Must be local - HybridMust have a valid LinkedIn profileDuration: 12+ months contractAs a Data Analyst within the Data Governance group of a Fortune 500 company, you will be responsible for analyzing, interpreting, and visualizing seed-related data to support data governance initiatives and drive operational efficiency. Based in Des Moines, Iowa, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather, analyze, and report on key data metrics, trends, and insights that inform strategic decision-making and drive continuous improvement.ResponsibilitiesUtilize statistical analysis techniques, data mining, and visualization tools to analyze large datasets related to seed production, supply chain operations, quality assurance, and manufacturing processes, identifying trends, patterns, and anomaliesPerform data quality assessments and audits to evaluate the accuracy, completeness, and consistency of seed-related data, identifying data governance issues, root causes, and opportunities for improvementDesign and develop interactive dashboards, reports, and data visualizations using tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or Excel, to communicate data governance metrics, KPIs, and insights to stakeholders effectivelyInvestigate data anomalies, discrepancies, and data quality issues, conducting root cause analysis and collaborating with cross-functional teams to implement corrective actions and prevent recurrenceIdentify opportunities to streamline data governance processes, enhance data collection, validation, and integration procedures, and automate data quality checks and reporting tasks to improve operational efficiency and effectivenessSupport data governance initiatives, including metadata management, master data management (MDM), and data privacy compliance, by providing analytical expertise, data profiling, and documentation support as neededCollaborate with stakeholders across the Global Seeds Operations Business function, including operations, supply chain, quality assurance, IT, and data governance teams, to understand data requirements, align analysis efforts with business objectives, and communicate insights effectivelyStay abreast of emerging trends and best practices in data analytics, data governance, and the agriculture industry, participate in training programs, workshops, and conferences, and share knowledge and insights with colleagues to foster a culture of learning and innovationQualificationsBachelor's in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or a related fieldMinimum of 5 years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or related roles, preferably in the agriculture or manufacturing sectorProficiency in data analysis tools and technologies, including SQL, Python, R, Excel, Power BI, or similar tools, with experience in statistical analysis, data visualization, and dashboard developmentStrong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights and recommendations for business stakeholdersExcellent communication, collaboration, and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams and communicate technical concepts to non-technical audiencesKnowledge of data governance principles, metadata management, and master data management (MDM) concepts is desirableWillingness to work at our headquarters in Johnston, Iowa, with potential for occasional travel as needed
